files.description: Defines the canonical StudyID/EffectID format, validation regexes, and helpers to normalize/compare IDs across files.
Implements a CLI-capable checker that loads CSV, JSONL, and prereg templates to report missing, duplicate, and mismatched StudyID/EffectID values with actionable error messages.
Provides robust readers/writers for CSV and JSONL and a parser for prereg templates to extract and validate ID fields consistently.
Builds structured check results and renders human-readable and machine-readable summaries of ID integrity issues.
Runs the checker against the included demo dataset to intentionally trigger an ID mismatch and prints the expected failure behavior.
Demo CSV dataset containing StudyID and EffectID columns including an intentional mismatch/duplicate to exercise the checker.
Demo JSONL dataset containing StudyID and EffectID fields including an intentional mismatch relative to the CSV to exercise cross-file checks.
Demo prereg template embedding StudyID and EffectID fields with an intentional mismatch to document expected checker failure behavior.
Documents the canonical StudyID/EffectID convention with examples, rationale, and how to add the ID fields to CSV, JSONL, and prereg templates.
Explains the demo datasetâ€™s intentional ID problems and enumerates the exact missing/duplicate/mismatched errors the checker should report.
Automated tests that run the checker on the demo dataset and assert the expected mismatch/duplicate/missing ID errors are detected.

missionDescription: Define a canonical StudyID/EffectID convention; add ID columns/fields to CSV + JSONL + prereg template; implement a checker that reports missing/duplicate/mismatched IDs; include a small demo dataset that intentionally triggers a mismatch and documents expected failure behavior.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete the urgent task identified by Meta-Coordinator

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Introduces a cross-artifact ID system that links extraction rows, taxonomy annotations, and prereg fields; the mismatch checker reduces silent errors and improves traceability across the full evidence...
